**Ashmar** is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [dwarvish roundshield](/wiki/Dwarvish_roundshield "Dwarvish roundshield") made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Ashmar can only be created by combining [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher") and [Trollsbane](/wiki/Trollsbane "Trollsbane") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)"); it cannot be wished for, and will revert to its base item if left in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file.

## Description

While worn, in addition to the [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") conferred by its base item (including bonus AC for [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)")), Ashmar confers [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and extrinsic [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") (which adds +MC1, up to MC3) - it also sets the player's [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") to 25, [prevents the wearer from being knocked backwards](/index.php?title=Steadfast\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Steadfast (page does not exist)"), and has a 1⁄4 chance of knocking monsters back upon deflecting their attack.

Ashmar can be combined with [The Sword of Annihilation](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Annihilation "The Sword of Annihilation") at a forge to create the [Armor of Retribution](/wiki/Armor_of_Retribution "Armor of Retribution").

## Strategy

Forging Ashmar comes at little to no cost, as its component artifacts are widely considered subpar or useless on their own, and any significant benefits they grant are also granted by Ashmar.

Acid resistance is a major boon in EvilHack's lategame, where many monsters will be able to cast the highly-damaging [acid blast](/wiki/Acid_blast_\(monster_spell\) "Acid blast (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") - combined with the half physical damage and other defensive attributes, this makes Ashmar an extremely powerful option for tanky, high-health characters and a way to even the playing field for a more frail character. The main drawback of using Ashmar is the same as all shields, i.e. giving up [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweaponing "Twoweaponing") artifacts or other weapons and losing out on higher damage ceilings, though the [shield](/index.php?title=Shield_\(skill\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shield (skill) (page does not exist)") skill can both further raise a characters defenses and even grant an additional bashing attack of its own at Skilled or better. The best weapons to pair with Ashmar are ones with very high damage potential against multiple monster types (e.g. [Hammer of the Gods](/wiki/Hammer_of_the_Gods "Hammer of the Gods")) or a high instakill chance (e.g. the [Sword of Annihilation](/wiki/Sword_of_Annihilation "Sword of Annihilation")).

## Encyclopedia entry

The Guardian, or 'Ashmar' as spoken in the dwarvish tongue.  
Arguably the best defense a warrior could ever hope to  
have. Rumor has it, the bearer of this magical shield  
could never be forced to retreat, and that its foes would  
be repelled should they dare to attack.

Ashmar is an artifact armor that appears in EvilHack. It is unaligned, and its base item is a dwarvish roundshield made of mithril.

Generation

Ashmar can only be created by combining Ogresmasher and Trollsbane at a forge; it cannot be wished for, and will revert to its base item if left in a bones file.

Description

While worn, in addition to the AC conferred by its base item (including bonus AC for dwarves), Ashmar confers half physical damage, hungerless regeneration, acid resistance, and extrinsic protection (which adds +MC1, up to MC3) - it also sets the player's constitution to 25, prevents the wearer from being knocked backwards, and has a 1⁄4 chance of knocking monsters back upon deflecting their attack.

Ashmar can be combined with The Sword of Annihilation at a forge to create the Armor of Retribution.

Strategy

Forging Ashmar comes at little to no cost, as its component artifacts are widely considered subpar or useless on their own, and any significant benefits they grant are also granted by Ashmar.

Acid resistance is a major boon in EvilHack's lategame, where many monsters will be able to cast the highly-damaging acid blast monster spell - combined with the half physical damage and other defensive attributes, this makes Ashmar an extremely powerful option for tanky, high-health characters and a way to even the playing field for a more frail character. The main drawback of using Ashmar is the same as all shields, i.e. giving up twoweaponing artifacts or other weapons and losing out on higher damage ceilings, though the shield skill can both further raise a characters defenses and even grant an additional bashing attack of its own at Skilled or better. The best weapons to pair with Ashmar are ones with very high damage potential against multiple monster types (e.g. Hammer of the Gods) or a high instakill chance (e.g. the Sword of Annihilation).

The Guardian, or 'Ashmar' as spoken in the dwarvish tongue.
Arguably the best defense a warrior could ever hope to
have. Rumor has it, the bearer of this magical shield
